channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OR

item.title: Report X-2024020117
item.description:
Report X-2024020117

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-25
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS A THIN UNPADDED PLASTIC ENVELOPE AND THE PRODUCT INSIDE SEEMED POSSIBLY REGULATED, RESPONDER CALLED HMSC AND THEY TOLD HIM TO PUT IT ON HOLD FOR REGULATORY COMPLIANCE INSPECTION, UNDECLARED HAZMAT.

item.title: Report X-2024010694
item.description:
Report X-2024010694

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-22
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 1/22/24, BNSF Portland IMF notified LARS of destination unit JBHU 332772 (billed HAZ, UN 1263, Flammable Aluminum Paint) which was observed to be leaking a liquid during the de ramping process. Upon inspection US Ecology observed a standard shipment of multiple 55g drums, the securement straps failed during transit, allowing the drums to shift. 1, 55 gallon drum had a pinpoint hole in the bottom of it, allowing approximately 5 gallons to leak from the drum.

item.title: Report X-2024020064
item.description:
Report X-2024020064

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-24
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE LEAKING CLASS 8 HAZMAT WAS RESPONDED TO BY RESPONDER IN THE WEST SECONDARY SORT AISLE AND THE PACKAGE WAS RETURNED TO THE PSC FOR PROCESSING. PACKAGE CONTENTS WERE PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP AS A LIQUID BY RESPONDER.

item.title: Report X-2024020098
item.description:
Report X-2024020098

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-22
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER FOUND LEAKING PACKAGE ON A PSC DMP RACK AFTER RESPONDER HAD BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE PSC FOR FURTHER PROCESSING AND STARTED WORKING ON PROCESSING IT FURTHER. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION, RESPONDER FOUND AEROSOL CANS INSIDE BUT NO HAZARDOUS MARKINGS OF ANY KIND ON THE OUTER PACKAGING, INCLUDING THE LACK OF LIMITED QUANTITY LABELS, HAZARD DIAMONDS, AND EXEMPTION NUMBERS. SUSPECTING THIS TO BE AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT, RESPONDER INFORMED RMP WHO THEN CALLED UP HMSC WHICH HAD US PUT IT ON HOLD FOR REGULATORY COMPLIANCE.

item.title: Report X-2024020144
item.description:
Report X-2024020144

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE LEAKING CLASS 8 HAZMAT WAS RESPONDED TO AT THE PD5 LOW VOLUME PICKOFF AND RETURNED TO THE PSC FOR PROCESSING. ALL MERCHANDISE WAS DAMAGED BY THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE AND ALL CONTENTS WERE PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP AS A LIQUID.

item.title: Report X-2024020096
item.description:
Report X-2024020096

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-29
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO RESPOND TO A LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE IN DOOR 2 OF THE UNLOAD, FOLLOWED THE PROPER PROCEDURES TO RESPOND TO THE PACKAGE. RESPONDER DISCOVERED A FIBERBOARD BOX CONTAINING 6 PLASTIC JUGS. THE PACKAGE WAS WET, TORN, AND HAD A HOLE IN IT. SOME OF THE BOTTLES HAD FALLEN OUT OF THE PACKAGE. ONE OF THE BOTTLES WAS CRUSHED AND MOST OF ITS CONTENTS HAD LEAKED OUT. RESPONDER CONTAINED THE PACKAGE AND ITS CONTENTS AND BROUGHT IT TO THE PSC FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024020079
item.description:
Report X-2024020079

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-26
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER FOUND A RAIN AFFECTED LIMITED QUANTITY PACKAGE IN THE PSC. RESPONDER CUT OPEN THE BOX TO SEE IF ANYTHING WAS AMISS WITH THE PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED SOME OF THE AEROSOLS WERE LEAKING AND ALSO HAD BEEN AFFECTED BY RAINWATER. RESPONDER PROCESSED THE PRODUCT THROUGH THE DAMAGED MATERIALS PROCESS.

item.title: Report X-2024010763
item.description:
Report X-2024010763

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: TROUTDALE
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: RAPICIDE WAS NOT SHIPPED IN PLASTIC BAG ALLOWING THE VENTED CAP TO LEAK INTERNALLY. DescribePack: VENTED CAP SIZE WAS APROXIMATELY THE DIAMETER OF A STANDARD GALLON MILK JUG. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN PLASTIC TOTE AND BROUGHT TO QA FOR INSPECTION.

item.title: Report X-2024010734
item.description:
Report X-2024010734

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: TROUTDALE
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking, removed from sortation, and brought to QA. DescribePack: One bottle of Lysol Mold & Mildew Remove with Bleach was leaking from a cracked cap. Package was many bottles of various cleaning chemicals, 3 of which were hazardous: Easy Off Cleaner Degreaser Heavy Duty UN1760, Lysol Mold 7 Mildew Remover with Bleach UN3266, and Sprayway Glass Cleaner UN1950. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined spill bin and brought to QA.

item.title: Report X-2024010693
item.description:
Report X-2024010693

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-21
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWAPPED DUE TO BEING WET FROM RAIN. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED 12 X 16 OUNCE COLEMAN ALL PURPOSE PROPANE CAMPING CYLINDERS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THE INNER BOX WAS MARKED AND LABELED AS UN1075, PETROLEUM GASES, LIQUEFIED WITH A CLASS 2 FLAMMABLE GAS DIAMOND. THE THERMAL LABEL SHIPPER NAME IS ONLY THE LETTER "A". THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM MARYLAND USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER V9321W, PRAXAIR, 105 PRAXAIR WAY, WILMINGTON OH 45177-7189.
